channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 2 Hollywood Movies That Totally Butcher Psychology, By A Psychologist
item.description: These two blockbuster movies’ box office success came at one great cost: the perpetuation of fear and misinformation.

item.title: Baltimore City Lawsuit Accuses Fintech MoneyLion Of Preying On Borrowers
item.description: The city is accusing the lender of misleading consumers and making loans without a lending license. Key issue: The use of recommended tips.

item.title: iOS 26.1: The Next iPhone Update Is About To Fix A Key Usability Feature
item.description: The redesign that came with iOS 26 brought lots of new features, but there was one, that felt like a misstep. It’s going to be corrected.

item.title: Google Starts Scanning Videos On Your Phone—How To Stop It
item.description: Google has silently installed this scanning app on your device — what to know.

item.title: The Next Great Race: Why America Can’t Afford To Lose Biotech Leadership To China
item.description: The U.S., once the undisputed leader in pharmaceutical innovation, risks losing its competitive edge unless decisive action is taken.

item.title: The thing about pressure
item.description: It doesn’t happen all at once. And it doesn’t work suddenly. A home pressure cooker doesn’t use more electricity than a hot pot. And it isn’t as fast ...

item.title: The grid
item.description: We talk about networks but we are rarely clear about what we mean. A specific sort of network is the grid, and even that idea is complicated by two co...

item.title: Status vs. goodness
item.description: It’s easy to come to the conclusion that people with means and high cultural status choose things that are better. Organic vegetables instead of junk ...

item.title: The questions before the questions
item.description: “I’m applying to work at Disney, do you know anyone who can give me a reference…” “My two partners and I are planning a new company, can we ask you fo...

item.title: Two kinds of confrontations
item.description: When we win by having someone else lose, we set up a conflict. It’s clear, direct but not generative. But when we win by confronting our fear, everyon...
